website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy, well-constructed tent with a variety of added features, including its unique sidewall.
pros: Comes in a choice of black or blue
Buyers love the inclusion of the sidewall
Easy to set up, and very portable
The height is adjustable to better block the sun
cons: The storage bag gets poor marks for its flimsy material and cheap zipper
Some buyers report quality issues with the fabric and poles

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Very sturdy and well constructed
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Very sturdy and well constructed. I do recommend The weights for windy events (Ohuhu Canopy Weight Bags for Instant Legs...). I am a DJ and it is just what I needed for outdoor events. You can raise and lower the height to keep the sun out. Cons: It only comes with one wall and the zip up bag is very flimsy. The bag got torn in shipping and it gets another rip every time I take it on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was easy enough to put up
customer_reviews.text: As I put this up for the first time some of the stitches at the corners started to break. I needed the canopy and di not want to deal with a return. However I am not that confident that the tent will last. It was easy enough to put up, but you definitely need at least two people. Decent enough, just a little let down by the quality of the stitching. Update: The company reached out to me after my review and sent me a new canopy at no cost. Not giving 5 stars because of the initial issues, but increasing to 4 because of their follow up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm Happy and I believe you will be too!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned several canopies (3) over the years and I can tell you that this canopy is without a doubt the easiest and safest to set up. I especially like that addition of orange buttons that help in raising and collapsing the tent. Art
customer_reviews.author: Art

customer_reviews.title: Too Wobbly
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Two separate sections have lost the screws already. I have only used this tent a half a dozen times. Easy to put up and down, but poorly made. Love the side wall. Cover is already showing pinholes.
customer_reviews.author: JacQui

customer_reviews.title: Great Canopy
customer_reviews.text: We took down a patio cover and needed something to cover a few things during the rain while we ready our house for sale. In very heavy constant rain (as we have been getting) it does leak. We also left it half way up because we didn't want it to blow away. For the price and size we feel it is a great buy. Could use a vent at the top if someone wanted to use in the wind.
customer_reviews.author: Lori in California

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the tent
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the tent. I assisted two males to put it up, who refused to look at the directions, but it was pretty easy to figure after a few minutes. Taking down was pretty quick with two other people. Would be easiest if we had a person at each pole...then it would take a minute. Is sturdy. I purchased the weights to hold it down. The little spikes that come with it are a bit of a joke...bent up one immediately. So, if you're going to get this tent, buy the weights.
customer_reviews.author: Sue W

customer_reviews.title: Ripped in two out of four corners prior to install ...
customer_reviews.text: Ripped in two out of four corners prior to install. Just received product about 5 minutes ago. Not sure how long this is going to last. Will be sure to buy locally next time and not online.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: As we opened the box, we discovered the carry bag was torn across the bottom. We contacted the company and we should be getting a replacement. The tent sets up easily. The biggest disappointment is that it is not waterproof as advertised. It leaks every place it is stitched. The sides connect at the top, with velcro, which is handy. The sides do not zip up at the corners, velcro is used. I do not like that.
customer_reviews.author: E. L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Hercules
customer_reviews.text: You have to be Hercules to engage the stop button. I am a male and it was very difficult for me. Also, the bag is a bit small and not super sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: No Name

customer_reviews.title: NOT WORTH THE MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this canopy on 5/5/20, it didn't get delivered until 5/19/20 and today...6/20/20 we had a sudden summer storm come up. No winds, just some rain. 45 minutes into the rain storm, my canopy collapses. Total piece of junk. Don't waste your money. Have been trying to reach out to this seller, but can't find a way to reach them. *** I need to add on here....The seller contacted me and has offered to replace the frame & canopy top free of charge. THIS was unexpected. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Tore right away.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace an old EZ up pop up and came across this one. Tore in the corner first time putting up! Frame was very sturdy but top just was too thin. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The craftsmanship and materials are 'top notch' from what Ah can determine so far. Exceeds my expectations. [Edit] Recently I had to replace one of them however' due to severe rain downpours here in S. Calif. One of my canopies completely collapsed due to extreme water weight it had collected instead of shedding. I am going to put simple drain holes in the canopies near the edges, so that it won't happen again.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID EDDY

customer_reviews.title: Great product don't forget weights.
customer_reviews.text: The product is great works out fine I think what most people who have complaints about it don't realize is that the tent is meant to use weights or to be staked into the ground in the few pictures that I've seen about people complaining that it broke or ripped they're not using weights or steaks so if you don't use the product like it's intended to be used you can expect it to break pretty simple.
customer_reviews.author: Chef Matthew Maiara

customer_reviews.title: A lot of Tent for the Price
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Tent cover is tightly fitted with Velcro corners to adhere to the posts. Locking points and expanding bars are solid. Hook points in corners and legs for flexible sidewall assembly on all sides a plus. Fold up and storage is easy and quick. Large buttons to assist when breaking down canopy are great. A lot of tent for a decent price. CONS: Legs not very stable when fully extended. Tent material rather thin (concerns of longevity / durability with extensive use). Do yourself a favor and have two people working to set up the tent initially (though it can be done by one person). This will reduce your setup time exponentially.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and easy to put up!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up, good quality, shipped quickly, very nice quality travel bag to pack it up in for use on the go. I'm using it on my patio to keep an area right off my back door dry when it rains. I'm really happy with it, the side benefits are it is also nice cover for some lawn furniture from the sun and the rain. I would recommend getting the weights for the feet if you are using it on cement the way I am, otherwise it comes with stakes to pound into soil to protect it from any wind.
customer_reviews.author: Janet P.

customer_reviews.title: Fades badly, very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had this canopy for a month. The fabric started fading after two weeks. You can see it has greatly faded. Sadly, because I paid more for this canopy over other ones I wanted because they had the color I wanted. But now the color doesn’t seem to matter if it looks aweful! Because of the fires happening here and the pandemic. I didn’t think to return before the 30 days and now I’m just outside of it and can’t talk to anyone about a return All that being said I like a lot of other things about the canopy
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: This tent is a true disappointment! Let’s start with the case. It ripped and is very difficult to put the tent into. Now... the tent, the sides don’t raise easily. The top (material) ripped. When I tried to return the first one, I was told, keep the broken tent,and the company would replace the tent. Upon receiving the new tent, we were charged for it. Then the second tent ripped. I now have 2 broken tents. I would not recommend this company or tent!!!
customer_reviews.author: ealvarez

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up with four people. Best for all people involved in the process to read directions first. Carton it comes in is very light weight and probably will not be used to store your canopy afterwards. Have a small sturdy box available to store waterproof top and accessories. If you will be using the canopy on a soft surface purchase real tent pegs. If used on windy days the legs must be weighted (held) down when setting it up on solid surfaces. All things considered this is a great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: furban

customer_reviews.title: Just right for some poolside shade!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for! Definately need two people to set up. Seems sturdy (only been up about a week) and secure so far. I use it by my pool which has no shade and in AZ you need shade!!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Sebastian

customer_reviews.title: I like the tent but quality of canopy is not worthy of price.
customer_reviews.text: The tent was easy to set up but you do need 3 to 4 people to spread out the frame. The canopy is thinner than expected but it did repel the rain the first day it was up. Also one of the Velcro strips wasn’t sewed on and hanging by a thread. I am keeping it because it is too big to bother returning it.. I do like the tent but the quality is not as good as expected for the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Inspired.by.terry

customer_reviews.title: Bought this canopy 1 1/2 years ago. It has ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this canopy 1 1/2 years ago. It has gone though wind and heavy rain storms. Others I had purchased in the past would have collapsed under these conditions. I do need to add that I purchase a set of sand bags that go around the legs to hold it down.With out any way of anchoring the canopy down it would blow away. This canopy does stay up from spring until football season for tailgating all the time.
customer_reviews.author: MR. K

customer_reviews.title: they have an excellent warranty program with no hassle
customer_reviews.text: One of the few reasonably priced waterproof tent options available. Additionally, they have an excellent warranty program with no hassle. I've used this tent to keep the back patio covered so I can grill without getting soaked on rainy days.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Change of rating
customer_reviews.text: I want to revise my former 4 star rating to a 5 star. The problem was that the zipper tab had broken on the first try, being made of a very lite metal. The company immediately sent out a new bag - excellent customer service response. So, just be carful when closing the zipper not to put too much bending pressure on it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Maheas-smith

customer_reviews.title: Working Out Well for Us
customer_reviews.text: This is working out really well for us - we've had it up for months now, & it is great, because we don't have any awnings (but we do have TONS of rain). We did weight the legs down - otherwise, with any windstorm, it'd be gone.
customer_reviews.author: Tamaya

customer_reviews.title: Probably better ones out there
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to assemble but did have small holes all over so the rain seeped in and dribbled down the inside of the canopy , it did keep us mostly dry. The material started to stretch leaving little holes wherever the attachments were sewn on . Its heavy but does come with a roller bag for easy transport .overall not perfect and hoping it lasts ,but it did its job!!
customer_reviews.author: kristi

customer_reviews.title: It's great. You will need help the first time you ...
customer_reviews.text: This tent has a lot more head room than most. It has an open top meaning that it has a high roof. It may be 10 X 10, but it is about 12 in height at the center. I have not ever seen a tent that has this type of roof. It's great. You will need help the first time you set it up, but that is normal for the first set up when you have to place the roof. That is the only time you need to do this and that is the same with all tents. Everyone at the craft fair was loving the tent.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Compact, sturdy, and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent for an arts & crafts event I vended for. Setup was easy - however, you will need an extra person to help. You may also want to purchase your own tent spikes, as the ones that are included are not sturdy. The sidewall worked very well, as it shielded us from chilly winds which helped keep us warm. It folded up well and fit nicely in the trunk of my mid-sized sedan. I highly recommend this for any of your canopy tent needs - outdoor vending, tailgating, picnic, or outdoor event.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa K.

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to use and attach the cover
customer_reviews.text: This canopy is well made. A bit more heavy and larger than I expected. It's easy to use and attach the cover. Have set up and fold together by myself multiple times without issues. Setup takes 10 minutes, wrapping up takes 5. Needs something to keep it in place in case of heavy winds. A wind gust turned the canopy over once, but the frame was not damaged.
customer_reviews.author: RV

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional! 2 years of Constant Use and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this 2 years ago and unless it is raining it is shade for our kids to play under. We are just needing to change the topper after 2 years of pretty much daily use! We are in an area with very mild to moderate weather. The frame is still going strong and we move it around the yard and take it to the beach a fair amount! This is an excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Using this canopy for camping. Put it up the first time yesterday and it locked in very easily. Love the Velcro corners!! Looking forward to lots of usage!! ETA- Frame very flimsy. Had the canopy staked and tied down. Weather became slightly windy and the frame twisted and broke on first usage. NOT HAPPY at all!!
customer_reviews.author: R. McClain

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and not good product.
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn't hold up to wind. We had some wind after erecting the unit. We screwed and secured the 4 legs to the deck but the upper frame bent, twisted and parts of the plastic joints and metal frame snapped. I got some old broom sticks and Gorilla tape and secured it to expand the usefulness throughout the rest of the summer but would not recommend the product.
customer_reviews.author: daniel a.waitzman

customer_reviews.title: Camping is Fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought the smaller 10 x 10 canopy due to having a pop-up camper with an attached canopy. Canopy is very easy to operate. Gives good shade and protection from the elements. Was skeptical about buying the white pop-up, but really liked the fact that it didn't retain heat like I believe a darker one would. Construction of the pop-up seems to be very sturdy, Have used it once since buying it, but extremely satisfied with its performance and manageability.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Ringer

customer_reviews.title: Poor materials. Poor customer service.
customer_reviews.text: the second time we put it up, a main brace broke in half. Adults who understand the procedure for raising pop up tents raised it carefully and it still broke. Weak materials. Contacted seller with no response.
customer_reviews.author: josefstuition

customer_reviews.title: Great for Family Events and Outings.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this canopy specifically for my daughter's birthday celebration. I planned a drive by celebration so I needed a canopy to provide us with some shade during a summer day. It was very easy to assemble, all the parts were complete and not broken, the storage bag it comes in has wheels so it's easy to travel with, the material felt heavy duty and sturdy ( I found no holes). We plan on using this for future family outings at the beach, park, and camping. I'm overall satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, Easy tear down
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome, I purchased it for a job to give me shade in the desert and I was able to adjust so it would sit at an angle. The carry bag seems a little under rated for the weight of the tent but it keeps it out of the elements. The straps have ripped but I'm still able to carry it. I've used this for the beach and currently using it as a patio cover since I'm renting a house right now.The company is very responsive and helpful with questions. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Glad we purchased the canopy and the company responded quickly to our issues.
customer_reviews.text: I received the canopy tent in time for my party and found it easy to setup. The cover had some flaws in the fabric and the the company shipped me a replacement cover. Dealing with them was easy and I am satisfied with the product. The framework is sturdy. It was easy to take down once the party was over.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Park

customer_reviews.title: Delivered in Oct 17 & Was not opened until March ...
customer_reviews.text: Delivered in Oct 17 & Was not opened until March 18 on vacation. The frame was bent to hell in several places. We still improvised & used it, but it was not able to function properly due to bent frame. I bought a square trade protection plan & I just send return request. We will see what happens from here.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Bag ripped first time out
customer_reviews.text: The canopy itself seems well made and works as expected. It was however difficult to put up with three people, never-mind two as suggested. My real complaint with this item is the canopy bag. It is so thin and cheaply made that it ripped the first time I tried to put the canopy in it! It was also too short so it wouldn't even have fit in it if it didn't rip.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up.
customer_reviews.text: We used this at our anniversary party to supplement a party tent and another canopy tent we already had. This one was used to protect guests from the afternoon sun that peeked through some trees. It is overall not as heavy in total weight as our other canopy of a similar design and size when it is dismantled for storage which we like. It was easier to put up than our other canopy. It is attractive. We are very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: nancypants1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. I did most of it by myself. I just needed my wife's help when it came time to raise it up. That part is a two person job. Not that its heavy, just that you need to be in two places at once. Love this Canopy tent though, just seems so much bigger than the picture
customer_reviews.author: Zcoil

customer_reviews.title: No good for inclement weather
customer_reviews.text: Brought on a camping trip. First night worked great. Second night it got windy and rainy. Canopy was staked in properly but the wind bent and broke the legs of the canopy and it came crashing down onto us in the tent beneath it. Probably great for a beach day but no good in inclement weather. Spent over a hundred bucks and only used once and then spent an hour in the rain trying to dismantle a mangled pile of rubble so I could get it in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Artymakestattoos

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good tent for the price. The metal pins that are inside the legs that allow you to set the tent height are made of cheap metal. One pin arrived broken upon receipt but alternative fixes easily available. Cover is fairly durable but the stitching is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy & a bit tricky to assemble
customer_reviews.text: A nice size for a canopy tent, though it was very long and heavy and thus difficult to transport and store. When we first assembled it, part of the canopy top tore as we were not understanding the assembly and tried to force it a bit too much. It's okay, but kind of a hassle to use.
customer_reviews.author: Eve

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Canopy
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible canopy. The first day we set it up it broke. We returned it right away. We went to set it up and went to grab the side to extend it and the arm broke we didn’t ever put any pressure on it or anything it just broke all by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Weak, weak product.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th tent of this brand, breaking in 1-2 months. All 4 reasons behind the malfunctioning of the product different. Refund? Send different one in replacement? Nobody will contact me back. 👎
customer_reviews.author: James F Jordan Jr

customer_reviews.title: RIP in cover and vicro strap not attached
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item and there's a hole in the cover and one of the vicro straps was not attached see photo please make this right
customer_reviews.author: charles dreachslin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and high quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and high quality. Definitely a good buy for me. Use it as a JW stand ;)
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Top leaked on arrival
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use on our patio as protection from the rain. Literally got it I'm and up on the same day, as we finally had a lull in the rain here in our area. We had no sooner gotten it set up, which was easy, but lo and behold, I have a canopy that is leaking in three different areas. Not even 30 minutes after it had been set up, we were getting dripped on.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Schultheiss

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Used it first as a sun shelter for softball tournament games. I thought it raised to a very adequate height. It was relatively lightweight, extended easily, and had ample headroom when canopy was raised. Canopy material is somewhat slight, but it's substantial enough. Durability is the only unknown at this point, but I am pleased and would recommend this canopy tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super canopy
customer_reviews.text: We bought the 10’ by 10’. After a couple of initial times, we learned to put it up and take it down without much trouble. It helps to have two people working on it. The frame is pretty heavy, but my husband could handle it. At first I was a little put off by how much the material looks like a shower curtain liner, but I got used to it. Buying the extra wall was a good move for keeping the hot sun off us. It’s easy to put on and take off. We did have a light rain one day and the canopy kept us dry. Overall, a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: E. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Not high quality,  but ok for the price
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is ok for a cheap canopy. The tie-down strings ripped off the second time used. Small holes appeared in the fabric, apparently from the frame in the storage bag? But, it's easy to set up, and getting me through probably one season at the farmers market.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cummings

customer_reviews.title: I was looking for a really good canopy and I found this
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a really good canopy and I found this. I used it at corgi beach day and it went amazing it's easy to setup and it's very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Gily

customer_reviews.title: which it does nicely. The canopy goes up very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for our band to use when playing outdoor gigs. The back panel was important in order to block the wind, which it does nicely. The canopy goes up very quickly. The Velcro straps for the cover make it very easy to secure to the frame. The whole thing also folds up very nice & compact for loading with all the band's gear. We also bought the optional sand bags which I highly recommend. They look great and really hold this thing down in the wind. Overall, this is an excellent product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything we expected in a canopy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a camping trip and it was everything I could have asked for. Sturdy, kept us dry in a rain storm and was not phased by the wind. Only issue we had was the roller bag tore the first time I picked up the bag at the seam where the side handles are, but that is the least of my worries. Great canopy. Already recommended to family to purchase. My 6 year old son was glad to learn I didn’t buy a can of pee like he thought we did. He was very excited to learn what exactly a canopy was.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: It is a very well construted Canopy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh i love this Canopy.. i did do few comparison be ordering my first one.. its not it the picture but i have two set up and both have 4 side sealed.. i have got 10X10 -2x4 wood going across the bottom on 2 less used sides and its removable when not needed.. yup its holds up pretty good and all my motorcycle is clean and dry ..
customer_reviews.author: Unitedx2012

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a key part not functioning properly. One of the buttons does not engage and so one side sags and I cannot get it to stay up without an excessive amount of zip ties. Also, the legs bow in a concerning fashion when it is on the highest setting and there was a part that was installed incorrectly and originally prevented it from extending to the full height and water dripped through during rain.
customer_reviews.author: Amy R.

customer_reviews.title: It blows!... away
customer_reviews.text: The Velcro ties started to rio off immediately. Took 3 of us to put it together. The wind almost carried it away because there is no vent hole at the top. I bought a better one at Walmart for a lot cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: P. Valdez

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't hold up in rain
customer_reviews.text: When we first put up the tent in the backyard it was great. Left it up in the backyard and didn't think too much about it being up during a rainstorm. Well, the next morning the Tent was BENT & on its side. The metal roof lines were BENT like TISSUE PAPER. Totally unusable. Very disappointed. Compared to a lesser cost brand that withstood the same rainstorm and didn't BEND OR BREAK! This product looks NICE but can't withstand a backyard rainstorm! Going into the Trash!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate reinforcement of stitching at seams and velcro tabs
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality canopy. Velcro tabs are NOT reinforced! The instruction sheet CLEARLY shows reinforcement. Tabs will pull through canopy within days. Most stitching is inadequate. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Shade
customer_reviews.text: I really like this shade. We have only used it once but it seems sturdy and easy to put up and take down. My only complaint is the bag was a super tight fit. There is not room to store the side wall. It would be helpful if there was and outside pocket for the sidewall and stakes and the bag should be looser. But it is a nice sturdy bag and maybe will loosen with time.
customer_reviews.author: over-thinker

customer_reviews.title: Theses are incredible!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to put on my deck for my family christmas party. It was raining so I need something WATERPROOF not resistant but waterproof. I bought 2 to cover my deck. I received them in a couple of days. The quality is great, storage is easy with the bags and they were WATERPROOF! I am excited to use them this summer for shade!
customer_reviews.author: Shelly Perkins

customer_reviews.title: I am very impressed with the quality of the sturdy frame and thick fabric covering
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality of the sturdy frame and thick fabric covering. The unit is easy to put up or take down, and looks like it is built to last. 6 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Bellman

customer_reviews.title: The canopy was very easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: The canopy was very easy to assemble. Two of us did it in about 45 minutes. The height extension is a great thing on it too. So far very happy. Have not tried to take down yet nor has it had to withstand a storm so let's see what happens
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Canopy Tent
customer_reviews.text: The canopy tent arrived in perfect condition. I, just myself, set it up, although it would have been easier with another person to open the frame. The UV resistance and waterproof canopy really is a plus as we get lots of sun & rain in Florida. The frame is all steel and the canopy well made so I anticipate many years use. I'm very happy with my purchase of this pop-up canopy tent.
customer_reviews.author: Merle Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy, but a bit heavy
customer_reviews.text: Really like this canopy. Bought it after our last one (different brand) broke. This one feels quite a bit sturdier, and the push-button release is a lot nicer than those little metal push pin thingies on the other ones. The extra sturdiness does come with an increase in weight, though, so it's more of a chore to cart it around.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Easy, nice tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a birthday party to make sure we had a shaded area at a park. Set up is super simple as long as you have two people. Although it could be possible to set up solo. We didn't actually end up using it because a pavillion opened up so we almost immediately packed the tent back up which was also a breeze. Will definitely use in the future.
customer_reviews.author: GumballWizard

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy. Great Sun Shade.
customer_reviews.text: This canopy was awesome!! Easy to put up akd study! We actually bought this one and another from a sports store. We returned the other because this one wa so nice. It rarely rains where we live so I can't speak for water resistance but overall, we loved this and will be buying another!
customer_reviews.author: Anderson

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: WE got to use this canopy twice. was great the 1st time, except the strap that is very cheaply sewn into the wall to attach to the frame ripped out of the wall. then the 2nd time we used the the bolt that helps support the scissor frame ripped right through the plastic brace. Really disappointed in the quality of the canopy so we returned and are looking for another.
customer_reviews.author: Dave M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: I use this to provide shade over my picnic table for eating lunch. I don't have any complaints about the product. It is probably intended for setup by two people, however I almost always do these kinds of things alone if possible. As I was moving from leg to leg and pulling it to stretch out, it got to be very difficult when nearly full stretch. I resolved the problem by using a clamp to pull it into position for the last locking snap.
customer_reviews.author: William P. Abernathy

customer_reviews.title: Well Built Tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent to be used for several work events. It is sturdy and easy to put up. Many people commented on it. I also bought sand bag weights from Amazon with velcro straps that I attached to each corner. I highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie M

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy shelter with attachable side for sun protection
customer_reviews.text: Seems more sturdy than our old one. I like the idea of the side shelter for sun protection. the only reason I didn't give it a 5 was that it was a bit harder to take down than our old one. you have to shrink the legs completely and then collapse.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Mathews

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We love this canopy! It's perfect for our small business, very professional looking as well as structurally sound. We were impressed with the quality. The sellers are also very quick to respond, making any issues you may have with your order easy to resolve. Fast shipping, too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: True product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the back yard where i keep my weight bench and punching bag. I was able to assemble by my self in 5 min. I have had this product for a few months and rain or shine i can be comfortable getting a work out in. Thanx
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Cisneros

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if the bag had wheels like most others do
customer_reviews.text: This canopy is very heavy. It would be nice if the bag had wheels like most others do. After using the canopy one time, the plastic end caps that keep the legs in place came loose. The legs don't lock in place like they should.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lankford

customer_reviews.title: ... until we used it to review it - very pleased. Went up and down easily
customer_reviews.text: Waited until we used it to review it - very pleased. Went up and down easily, bulky but not difficult to move in its case, stood up to the wind. Nothing tore, nothing gave way. No problems. We expect to use it often for outdoors events.
customer_reviews.author: TheRedQueen

customer_reviews.title: Can take the elements!
customer_reviews.text: We use this canopy for camping over the weekend in July and it was hot, this canopy was a blessing it keeped us out of the sun and held up good in down pour would highly recommend this canopy to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Jason D Spies

customer_reviews.title: New came with no cover
customer_reviews.text: I opened this for the first time a year after ordering only to find out that it was only the frame and the bag was full of rocks.
customer_reviews.author: joshua sasse

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by the quality
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality fir the money. I owned other pop up tents from cheap to expensive so for under $200 I wasn't expecting much. Quality is descent and easy to setup-the side privacy curtain is a snap to install and works well
customer_reviews.author: David Haas

customer_reviews.title: The bag is junk. Canopy not well made.
customer_reviews.text: This was a terrible purchase. We have put it up two times and a push button is broken and a side has a small hole. The bag it comes in is all ripped up by the wheels because when you drag it it turns on you. My husband is a muscular man and it gives him trouble. We bought this to replace a canopy we had for 9 years. Last game we used the old one.
customer_reviews.author: hardy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble just as described.
customer_reviews.text: Came in perfect condition, no tears and was easy to install. Someone stated taking three people to put it up, it does not takes three people to put this thing up did it by myself to makes sure everything was OK with it. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: The Rons

customer_reviews.title: It Has Worked Functionally
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy and fast. While the product meets expectations for what it is expected to do, its quality of material for canopy and side wall itself are suspect. We don't have a confidence it will last long. The side wall velcro straps have already come unattached from in less than 30 days from setup requiring rigging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE!!! I bought this tent a month ago and decided to put it up today for a bbq. It is out of the return window so I don’t have the option of returning this tent. It lasted 30 minutes. What a waste of money. I ordered 10lb weights to hold it in place as well. Nothing worked. A wind gust and a shower knocked it over and bent a leg and broke some other poles at the top of the tent. I am so disappointed with this product. My daughter’s birthday is tomorrow and now I have to go out and purchase another tent!!
customer_reviews.author: James Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price, the only parts that really look weak are the Velcro canopy attachments. I’d expect those to wear down in a strong wind. However I accidentally forgot to take this down before a small thunderstorm blew through the other day(with the feet weighed down) and it survived a few very significant gusts of wind, so it’s sturdier than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Sonnet Murray

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This was the best investment we ever made for the beach. Not too heavy, and easy setup. Holds up good with a steady sea breeze blowing. We couldn’t be more happier, made our beach trip that much better.
customer_reviews.author: joe cole

customer_reviews.title: Great canopy! It’s not as quick as the easy ...
customer_reviews.text: Great canopy! It’s not as quick as the easy up ones, but much better quality. Nice and large and the UV protection is nice!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Nance

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality - glad I did my research
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality - glad I did my research. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a pop up canopy.
customer_reviews.author: DCP

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: We used it at a community fair, as a "booth". We didn't use the side wall as a side wall; we propped it op, extending the coverage and allowing a larger table, which we needed because we had both literature and a bake sale . All in all very happy, and we're hoping it'll perform as well *next* year. PS Because all the booths are set up on the street (concrete), there's no way to peg the supports to the ground; I got weights (which slip over the struts) and they worked very well holding the "booth" steady.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara P. Duvall

customer_reviews.title: Really great quality and very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality and very easy to use. I was surprised at how quickly it went up with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael B

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy canopy
customer_reviews.text: Good quality material. No rips when arrived. Took a little while to pull it appart and you do need man power to pull it. Not sure how it can be carried regularly to events. Easy to disassemble
customer_reviews.author: Natalia

customer_reviews.title: Great quality canopy!
customer_reviews.text: Love this canopy! Sturdy, good quality, easy to set up. I am actually able to set it up by myself! I only wish it came with a roller bag. Carrying it on my back in order to transport it to the setup site can be a workout. Oh well, lol. I get a lot of compliments on how nice and well made it looks!
customer_reviews.author: Rita

customer_reviews.title: Ok Canopy Tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice simple canopy...works great. My only complaint is that that tarp cover doesn't really fit into the bag that holds the metal frame. When the metal frame is folded up it pretty much takes up the bag, so storing the cover has to be done separately.
customer_reviews.author: patrick donley

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality stitching
customer_reviews.text: These Velcro straps hold the canopy to the frame. Two have fallen off, the other are close to falling off as you can see from the picture examples. It’s a quality issue and these were not attached very well. We camp and this pop up has seen maybe 10 days of use with 0 to light wind. We have had it 4 months. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: SamDirt

customer_reviews.title: did not fly away, leak or break down on us.
customer_reviews.text: Love the Canopy! Easy to set up and secure. We were expecting wind and light rain and we wanted to use one of those under canopy camping tent Specifically "  " and it worked out perfect, but just to be over secured, we added waterproofing to the stitchings and edges just to be sure it would not leak and also tired all the anchors and used weights on each leg. Needless to say, it did not fly away or break down on us.
customer_reviews.author: isaac8480

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof!!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this canopy is great for the money! It wasn’t super flimsy but also not extremely sturdy, in the middle. What shocked me was how waterproof the canopy actually is. I took this on a road trip to Olympic National park and it rained for 3 days, not a SINGLE drop or leak from this canopy. Kept our campsite/rent completely dry. Amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed straps
customer_reviews.text: Goes up easy and looks nice however upon closer inspection, the Velcro straps that keep the Soviet attached to the frame are stitched to the canopy itself, compromising the canopy, leaving holes in it AND the stitching is really bad, some straps just had like 5 stitches holding it on, when I went to attach it to the frame the straps simply came off leaving holes in the canopy itself.
customer_reviews.author: Tarrant220

customer_reviews.title: Easy pop up tent
customer_reviews.text: We have used this outdoors at least 15 times so far and it works great. Seems durable even in somewhat windy conditions - as long as you put weight on the legs!!!! We put the top away somewhat wet once though and it began to mold so don't make our mistake. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: staringdownthesun

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine selection.
customer_reviews.text: This product is fine. It has a little less structure than more expensive tents and I have only used this twice. I can not report on waterproofness, durability over time, or the use of the included wall. So far it is perfect for good weather to keep the sun off you. Weight s should be added if there will be wind.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M.

customer_reviews.title: really good
customer_reviews.text: it works, however they missed sending me the weight bags but i contacted them and they told me they will send me them. (still waiting)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to many years of use
customer_reviews.text: Easy setup & take down (even by just 1 person), the cover fit taught over the frame and stayed snug. The case seems durable and everything fit back inside after use comfortably. Only question I could still have is how it holds up in the long run, but I have no reason at this point to be worried.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Only 10 by 10 but seems bigger. Roomy. ...
customer_reviews.text: Only 10 by 10 but seems bigger. Roomy. Was hopping for a one person set up but really needs two people. would have been a 5 but the zipper clasp broke when I was storing the tent in the bag. And the bag needs wheels.
customer_reviews.author: John Bass

product_meta.title: Punchau Pop Up Canopy Tent 10 x 10 Feet, Red - UV Coated, Straight Leg, Waterproof Instant Outdoor Gazebo Tent, Bonus Roller Carry Bag
feature_bullets: PROTECTION FROM THE ELEMENTS - Enjoy your canopy tent rain or shine! UV coated to block out the sun’s harmful rays and waterproof to protect from the rain.

BUILT TO LAST - Made with durable 420D Oxford Polyester with a silver coating, and a sturdy powder coated steel frame. Punchau stands behind all of its canopies 100%. The Pop Up Canopy Tent 10 x 10 comes with an automatic 1 year warranty. Register online for a FREE TWO YEAR WARRANTY.
INSTANT SHADE - This lightweight pop up canopy features a Quick Release Button that makes set up and take down quick and easy, providing shade and endless hours of fun for you and your loved ones.

COMPACT STORAGE - Low profile design folds down small, making it easy to carry and fit in the trunk of most mid sized cars and suvs. Includes a 4 PIECE STAKE SET and FREE ROLLER CARRY BAG with shoulder strap for convenient transport.
ADJUSTABLE HEIGHT & HIGH CEILING - Features 3 adjustable heights at 65", 69", and 73". Plus, there’s no cross bar in the middle of the canopy to get in the way of tall users.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars925 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
